formalpara.title: Decide whether to stop testing
formalpara.para: Positive case: Testing can be stopped and the software certified as fit for use if the current values of the certification measures satisfy certification goals and if no failures have been observed during testing of the current software version (or none worth the cost and risk of correction).

glossdef.para: Negative case: Testing should be stopped and the software reengineered and reverified if process control standards have been violated. Violation of process control standards occurs when certification goals cannot be achieved given current values of the certification measures and the remaining schedule and resources for testing.
Document decisions in the Increment Certification Report.
